pullRequest.body:
Prove that any Galois group is profinite.

---

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> ### PR summary [a109bcc6f9](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16993/commits/a109bcc6f94679f5bc29fadb1f5a25119d5d6554)

> #### Declarations diff

This is because when creating the file, only part of the result thus only part of the imports are needed, but they all surve for proving the Galois group is profinite, so I think thet should still be put in one file.

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Somebody have already gave a better fix for `map_comp`, it is only some merge problem, never mind about the review I misclicked above.

Like in #16992, do we also need the `Category.Iso` in `ProfiniteGrp` too ? 
I think the question here is whether we need the things after `profiniteGalGrp`  as mentioned in above?
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by chrisflav.
For the record: I think large import is fine here, this is a leaf file and this is only because Nailin split the theory in this file in multiple PRs.

:v: Thmoas-Guan can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Great work, it LGTM but I left some (mainly aesthetical) comments, plus a couple of implicit/explicit variable ones. I am also unsure about the names
> `isOpen_mulEquivToLimit_image_fixingSubgroup` and `mulEquivToLimit_symm_continuous`: are you sure they're consistent? I'd imagine that either both should begin with `mulEquivToLimit`, or none of them.

I think there is an (unwritten) rule to treat `co tinuous` like `injective`, i.e. to put it at the end instead of in order of appearance. Is that what you mean, Filippo?

> > Great work, it LGTM but I left some (mainly aesthetical) comments, plus a couple of implicit/explicit variable ones. I am also unsure about the names
> > `isOpen_mulEquivToLimit_image_fixingSubgroup` and `mulEquivToLimit_symm_continuous`: are you sure they're consistent? I'd imagine that either both should begin with `mulEquivToLimit`, or none of them.
> 
> I think there is an (unwritten) rule to treat `co tinuous` like `injective`, i.e. to put it at the end instead of in order of appearance. Is that what you mean, Filippo?

I was more concerned about the beginning. I would have imagined that `isOpen` and `image` should come closer in the first name (and `mulEquivToLimit` at the beginning). Something like `multEquivToLimit_isOpen_image_fixingSubgroup`?

> > > Great work, it LGTM but I left some (mainly aesthetical) comments, plus a couple of implicit/explicit variable ones. I am also unsure about the names
> > > `isOpen_mulEquivToLimit_image_fixingSubgroup` and `mulEquivToLimit_symm_continuous`: are you sure they're consistent? I'd imagine that either both should begin with `mulEquivToLimit`, or none of them.
> > 
> > I think there is an (unwritten) rule to treat `co tinuous` like `injective`, i.e. to put it at the end instead of in order of appearance. Is that what you mean, Filippo?
> 
> I was more concerned about the beginning. I would have imagined that `isOpen` and `image` should come closer in the first name (and `mulEquivToLimit` at the beginning). Something like `multEquivToLimit_isOpen_image_fixingSubgroup`?

I think this violates the naming convention of naming in order of appearance, hence it makes the name harder to predict IMO.

> > > > Great work, it LGTM but I left some (mainly aesthetical) comments, plus a couple of implicit/explicit variable ones. I am also unsure about the names
> > > > `isOpen_mulEquivToLimit_image_fixingSubgroup` and `mulEquivToLimit_symm_continuous`: are you sure they're consistent? I'd imagine that either both should begin with `mulEquivToLimit`, or none of them.
> > > 
> > > 
> > > I think there is an (unwritten) rule to treat `co tinuous` like `injective`, i.e. to put it at the end instead of in order of appearance. Is that what you mean, Filippo?
> > 
> > 
> > I was more concerned about the beginning. I would have imagined that `isOpen` and `image` should come closer in the first name (and `mulEquivToLimit` at the beginning). Something like `multEquivToLimit_isOpen_image_fixingSubgroup`?
> 
> I think this violates the naming convention of naming in order of appearance, hence it makes the name harder to predict IMO.

So what is the conclusion? Whhat name do you prefer for the two lemma?

> > > > > Great work, it LGTM but I left some (mainly aesthetical) comments, plus a couple of implicit/explicit variable ones. I am also unsure about the names
> > > > > `isOpen_mulEquivToLimit_image_fixingSubgroup` and `mulEquivToLimit_symm_continuous`: are you sure they're consistent? I'd imagine that either both should begin with `mulEquivToLimit`, or none of them.
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > I think there is an (unwritten) rule to treat `co tinuous` like `injective`, i.e. to put it at the end instead of in order of appearance. Is that what you mean, Filippo?
> > > 
> > > 
> > > I was more concerned about the beginning. I would have imagined that `isOpen` and `image` should come closer in the first name (and `mulEquivToLimit` at the beginning). Something like `multEquivToLimit_isOpen_image_fixingSubgroup`?
> > 
> > 
> > I think this violates the naming convention of naming in order of appearance, hence it makes the name harder to predict IMO.
> 
> So what is the conclusion? Whhat name do you prefer for the two lemma?

Leave it as it is, thanks.
Thanks, this look good to me! You can proceed and merge with bors r+
